thread.title: Retirees Are Less Confident About Having Enough to Live On

author: Anne Tergesen
title: Retirees Are Less Confident About Having Enough to Live On
text:
The economy is strong and stocks are near record levels. But a long-running survey shows retireesâ€™ confidence in having enough money to cover basic living expenses has dropped over the past year, due in part to concerns about medical expenses.
Released Tuesday by the nonprofit Employee Benefit Research Institute, the survey shows that 80% of polled retirees are optimistic about their ability to afford basic expenses, down from 85% last year.
